lexUnit.name: swear.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: state or promise solemnly or on oath.

sentence.text: ` I 'll always be with you , " he swore .
Give us a word , Angus -- go on -- make these ` gentlemen " swear the oath !
He 'd swear of course that he 'd never again steal me from my proper duties with the children .
When we sailed from France I swore that I would lead us safely home and I do not mean to be forsworn . "
As he looked down at her sleeping face , sucking contentedly on her thumb , he swore that he would commit murder if it kept his family as happy as they were now .
Then Stephen swore that he could drop everyone at their digs in the Argyll .
I could n't swear that a thalidomide sort of accident will never happen again , but the chance of it happening are much less .
Bapji swore he would be here before twelve . "
The son of the family went to California , learnt what made the Californians tick , and swore he could do as well , if not better , back in France .
I want the pair of you dressed and off this train in five minutes -- or I swear I 'll drag you off in your pyjamas ! "
I swear I will try .
I had sworn never to call her aunt again , but I did not regret breaking that promise to myself .
The allies had sworn to expel these with fire and sword ; but the enormous scope of such an operation , when the whole north had surrendered , led to its being quietly dropped .
They took a vow like those of the Middle Ages where someone swore to go on crusade if his wife 's life was saved .
` Seventeen lairds have sworn to oppose the Militia Act , " said Menzies flatly .
The lord gave his vassal protection , and rewarded him ; the vassal swore to serve his lord .
` After Stephen was captured I swore to serve the Queen until his release , to obey her commands as I would the King 's .
But then Lais had to let Peach in on the big secret , and she had her swear never to tell it to anyone -- whatever happened .
` You swear to tell no one ? " she asked .
One such society , the Ribbonmen , decided that Father Cavanagh must be punished for preaching non-violence , and swore a solemn oath to cut off the priest 's ears .
Many Saxons were baptised and swore oaths to remain loyal , on threat of forfeiture of their lands and freedom .
` Stephen swore a sacred oath to recognise Matilda as Queen .
Charles made his subjects swear a new form of allegiance to him as emperor , the vow being administered to all people over the age of twelve :
He kept apologising to Nellie and swearing undying devotion to her .
` I swore no oath to Matilda , " he grated .
Immediately after Innocent 's election , the senator , Scottus Paparonis , resigned , which paved the way for the nomination of a successor who swore fealty to the pope .
I swear it to you .
The car-crushing came courtesy of Vinnie Parkes , Miss Dyson 's ex-boyfriend , who swore revenge after arguments when the couple split up four months ago .
Louis 's men then swore an equivalent oath in the lingua teudisca .
The mother who swore to everyone that she loved her children !
I swear to God it was unbelievable !
I did n't know that they could , but I 'd always sworn to her that I would never involve her in any way and I 've never broken my word .
` Not because of the oath he swore to Matilda ? " queried Hugh interestedly .
Death 's mercy has held off all too long , but now I swear to you this is ending .
I swear to you .
It is a beautiful car , I swear to you . "
I swear to you that I did n't know anything about it neither can my sister know , or she would n't have gone with Garry .
` I swear on my honour and conscience , my loyalty to the Czechoslovak Socialist Republic , " he said .
I swear that he might have twisted it off had I understood what it would mean to Garcia .
